intro: Hemimeris nana, commonly known as the dwarf hemimeris, is a small flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other familiar plants like the evening primrose. The plant is characterized by its compact stature, with hairy stems and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Hemimeris nana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
